name: process_airflow

arguments.name: selectedliving
arguments.display_name: Which is the living space zone

arguments.name: userdefinedinflivingspace
arguments.display_name: Air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour at 50 Pascals , for above-grade living space

arguments.name: userdefinedconstinflivingspace
arguments.display_name: Air exchange rate, in natural Air Changes per Hour , for above-grade living spaceUsing this variable will override the AIM-2 calculation method with a constant air exchange rate

arguments.name: userdefinedinfsheltercoef
arguments.display_name: The local shelter coefficient  accounts for nearby buildings, trees and obstructions

arguments.name: selectedgarage
arguments.display_name: Which is the garage zone

arguments.name: selectedfbsmt
arguments.display_name: Which is the finished basement zone

arguments.name: userdefinedinffbsmt
arguments.display_name: Constant air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour , for the finished basement

arguments.name: selectedufbsmt
arguments.display_name: Which is the unfinished basement zone

arguments.name: userdefinedinfufbsmt
arguments.display_name: Constant air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour , for the unfinished basementA value of 00 ACH or greater is recommended for modeling Heat Pump Water Heaters in unfinished basements

arguments.name: selectedcrawl
arguments.display_name: Which is the crawlspace zone

arguments.name: userdefinedinfcrawl
arguments.display_name: Air exchange rate, in Air Changes per Hour at 50 Pascals , for the crawlspace

arguments.name: selectedunfinattic
arguments.display_name: Which is the unfinished attic zone

arguments.name: userdefinedinfunfinattic
arguments.display_name: Ratio of the effective leakage area  in the unfinished attic to the total floor area of the attic

arguments.name: userdefinedneighboroffset
arguments.display_name: The minimum distance between the simulated house and the neighboring houses

arguments.name: userdefinedhomeage
arguments.display_name: Age of home Enter 0 for new construction

arguments.name: selectedterraintype
arguments.display_name: Site terrain type

arguments.name: selectedventtype
arguments.display_name: Ventilation strategy used

arguments.name: selectedinfilcredit
arguments.display_name: If True, the ASHRAE 62 infiltration credit will be included for buildings with infiltration that exceeds a default rate of 2 cfm per 100sqft of finished floor area

arguments.name: userdefinedtotaleff
arguments.display_name: The net total energy  recovered by the supply airstream adjusted by electric consumption, case heat loss or heat gain, air leakage and airflow mass imbalance between the two airstreams, as a percent of the potential total energy that could be recovered plys the exhaust fan energy
arguments.units: sensible plus latent, also called enthalpy

arguments.name: userdefinedsenseff
arguments.display_name: The net sensible energy recovered by the supply airstream as adjusted by electric consumption, case heat loss or heat gain, air leakage, airflow mass imbalance between the two airstreams and the energy used for defrost , as a percent of the potential sensible energy that could be recovered plus the exhaust fan energy
arguments.units: when running the Very Low Temperature Test

arguments.name: userdefinedfanpower
arguments.display_name: Fan power  per delivered airflow rate  of fan providing whole house ventilationIf the house uses a balanced ventilation system thtere is assumed to be two fans operating at this efficiency

arguments.name: userdefinedfracofashrae
arguments.display_name: Fraction of the ventilation rate  specified by 2010 ASHRAE 62 that is desired in the bulding

arguments.name: userdefineddryerexhaust
arguments.display_name: Rated flow capacity of the clothes dryer exhaustThis fan is assumed to run 60 min/day between 11am and 12pm

arguments.name: userdefinedhtgoffset
arguments.display_name: The temperature offset below the hourly cooling setpoint, to which the living space is allowed to cool during months that are only in the heating season

arguments.name: userdefinedclgoffset
arguments.display_name: The temperature offset above the hourly heating setpoint, to which the living space is allowed to cool during months that are only in the cooling season

arguments.name: userdefinedovlpoffset
arguments.display_name: The temperature offset above the maximum heating setpoint, to which the living space is allowed to cool during months that are in both the heating season and cooling season

arguments.name: selectedheatingssn
arguments.display_name: True if windows are allowed to be opened during months that are only in the heating season

arguments.name: selectedcoolingssn
arguments.display_name: True if windows are allowed to be opened during months that are only in the cooling season

arguments.name: selectedoverlapssn
arguments.display_name: True if windows are allowed to be opened during months that are in both the heating season and cooling season

arguments.name: userdefinedventweekdays
arguments.display_name: Number of weekdays in the week that natural ventilation can occur

arguments.name: userdefinedventweekenddays
arguments.display_name: Number of weekend days in the week that natural ventilation can occur

arguments.name: userdefinedfracwinopen
arguments.display_name: Specifies the fraction of the total openable window area in the building that is opened for ventilation

arguments.name: userdefinedfracwinareaopen
arguments.display_name: Specifies the fraction of total window area in the home that can be opened (etypical sliding windows can be opened to half of their area

arguments.name: userdefinedhumratio
arguments.display_name: Outdoor air humidity ratio above which windows will not open for natural ventilation

arguments.name: userdefinedrelhumratio
arguments.display_name: Outdoor air relative humidity  above which windows will not open for natural ventilation

modeler_description: Using EMS code, this measure processes the building's airflow (infiltration, mechanical ventilation, and natural ventilation).
description: This measure processes infiltration for the living space, garage, finished basement, unfinished basement, crawlspace, and unfinished attic. It also processes mechanical ventilation and natural ventilation for the living space.
